1111.content:
Vanunome is a primitive island southwest of Papua. Although technically under the government of Papua New Guinea, the island remains too primitive for the Papua government to do anything beyond patrolling the surrounding ocean. Like many of the primitive populations around the world, they live without census, medical care, education, or roads.

Vanunome does have a primitive port through which they trade for goods from the outside world. They even have three television sets shared by the hundreds of islanders. They are not starving. They do practice primitive agriculture which provides them with beans, fruits, tubers and rice, all of which are native variants only found on Vanunome. It is their agriculture that they use to trade for modern conveniences.

Ben and Jason go to Vanunome for three lucrative reasons. One is to see if the market for the rice or fruit can be improved to increase the wealth of the islanders. Two is to make a documentary about the culture. Three is that they've been promised land of their own on the island and jobs as government representatives if they are successful at setting up the fruit or rice markets.

At the port, everything is friendly. They meet a Vanunome native named Ralu who speaks English and agrees to be their guide. However, before they can venture into the island past the port, they must submit to Vanunome customs.

Ralu explains, "We are a male dominated culture. Status and rank are determined by the size of our genitals. We have ways of increasing the size of those who are small. In our culture, covering the genitals is shameful, only done by women and those with child-sized genitals. If you want to be respected in our culture, you must allow us to measure your genitals and paint them according to size: blue for the largest followed by green, white, red, and yellow for the smallest unless they are too small to paint."
1111.title: Among Primitives

1121.content:
A little history: Humans have been travelling to other stars for centuries. They have not found any sentient natives yet but they have found suitable planets for colonization. Some do have indigenous life forms but the alien life is small like plants and insects. No alien vertebrates have been discovered yet.

Humans have colonized these planets and the colonists adapted to the planets they colonized. That is, if the planet had low gravity, the colonists became taller and lankier. They developed their own cultures and became like natives. Then came the revolts as each colony declared its independence from whatever Earth government had planted it. It became expected that all new colonies would declare independence but different governments had different strategies for handling that. Some cracked down harder refusing to let go of their colonies while others made arrangements from the get go to allow the colonies independence.

Earth never did develop a single world government although they did manage to unite into twelve governments as opposed to nearly two hundred. But factions didn't want to give up power. Instead, they each wanted their own one world government until their were twelve competing "United Nations" like governments. There was the European Union, the North American Hegemony (Canada won the war and then went power crazy), the Latin American Union, the North African Union, the South African Union, the Muslim Brotherhood, the Pacific Union (with a capital in New Zealand which had become a world power), the Oriental Union, the Indostanic Union, the Russian Hegemony, the Anti-union rebellion, and Australia.

With each colony on a planet other than Earth declaring indepence, the number of governments rose back to nearly two hundred again but space prevented interstellar war. The people of each new planet claimed their planet as their national identity regardless of their DNA. That is, if a group of Caucasians, Africans and Asians settled on the planet Eridani, they abandoned the words Caucasian, African and Asian. Instead, they identified themselves as Eridanians.

What culture developed on each planet depended primarily on two main factors: the parental government from which the colony broke free from and the conditions of the planet itself. For example: A colony set out from the North American Hegemony to colonise the planet Scauda which is a cold planet. Both the North American, Mormon/Victorian hypermorality and the freezing cold temperatures of Scauda cause the culture to never expose the slightest bit of skin.
1121.title: What'the need?

Palatonga itself is populated by a mixture of natives, Japanese, Australian, Peruvian, Chilean, and other nationalities but the few other inhabited islands are pure Palatongan, some of whom preserve their ancient culture and superstitions.

Palatonga is technically an independent country but only because it's too far from any other land for any country to claim. The Palatonga government doesn't have a miltary and their police force is too small to patrol more than a few strategically chosen checkpoints. Corruption is well known in the Palatonga government. 114111.content:
Chikun Pentathlon is a sport in which teams of two compete in five different events. In all five events, one member of the team has to ride on the shoulders of the other team member.

The first of the five events is a race. The rider is referred to as a jockey and the carrier is referred to as a pony. The second event is similar to a ball game like basketball or rugby however the points are not earned by defeating an opponent but by which baskets the jockey succeeds in getting the ball into. The pony has to run through a field of obstacles to get to the different baskets and there is a time limit. Several teams are on the field at the same time but no team is rewarded for blocking another team. The third event is archery where both the jockey and pony aim for bullseyes. The fourth event is a tug of war and is the first event where points are awarded for defeating an opponent. The fifth event is called jousting but wrestling like moves are allowed. The jousting field is a padded platform surrounded by padded balance beams. Each team starts on the end of a balance beam and runs to the central platform. As many as four teams are allowed to joust on the same platform in rotation and points are awarded for each jockey dismounted. That is if a jockey stays on the platform dismounting twenty other jockeys, he gets twenty points. However, if a jockey is dismounted, he has to wait until other teams have had a fair chance on the field before he can mount his pony and get back on the field. The first teams on the field are given fewer opportunities to re-enter the field to make it fair to the last teams on the field but each team has a minimum of five opportunities to get joust.

Teams are supposed to begin each event riding on shoulders but they are allowed to change riding methods as soon as the event begins as long as no part of the jockey touches the ground and as long as the jockey rides his own pony (doesn't climb onto someone elses pony).
114111.title: Chikun Pentathlon

11511.content:
World War III happened. Humanity survived but technology had a set back.

The main weapon used was biological warfare but both sides used it so both sides suffered. Other weapons were also used so that all major cities were in ruins but less significant cities such as Topeka, Kansas; Boise, Idaho and Fargo, North Dakota still stood. However, still standing did not mean undamaged. The decrease in population was worldwide and many of the still standing buildings were abandoned. It became common for everyone to move to the suburbs and rural areas. There was no inner city anymore because there were so many nice houses available in the suburbs for free.

Electricity and running water was still available. Even the internet still worked although there was less entertainment because there were fewer people who could create entertainment. The world population only dropped to about 1.5 billion so plenty of people survived but globalization ended. Everyone retreated to their own region. Large nations broke up into smaller nations no bigger than Great Britain.

But the war continued. Even after the great super powers of the world broke apart, civil wars replaced the big war as regions fought to establish new borders. Even after the weapons of mass destruction were forgotten, people resorted to old fashioned rifles and helicopters. Even after the last people exposed to biological warfare had been cured, people resorted to old fashioned tortures such as the rack, stockade and cage.

1311.content:
The Inventor, Paul Ralston, is eccentric. He insists that people call him "The Inventor" or "Mister Inventor". If he wasn't such a genius, he would have been put in a mental hospital. Instead, he is a professor of physics but the university hires several T.A.s to look after him.

The Inventor lives in an old, Mock Tudor style home by himself. It is a large house with many rooms including a basement, second floor and attic but most of the rooms are filled with The Inventors various collections. These collections are strange but useful. He has collected several microscopes, bunsen burners, molecular model sets and other pieces of scientific equipment.

The Inventor himself has thin but blindingly white hair. He either wears a tweed jacket with patches on his elbows or a blue sweater with patches on his elbows. He often has a pipe in his mouth but no one has ever seen him smoke with it.

Jason knocks on the door. He has been hired by the university but this is his first time meeting the strange professor. Jason has heard rumors and seeing the messy condition of the home only confirms that those rumors might be true.

The Inventor hollers, "Come in." Jason opens the front door, walks through the vestibule and foyer before finding the professor sitting at a large desk covered in papers on one end of a library. Piles of books are everywhere: too many to fit on the shelves.

"Hello, I'm Jason Fletcher. The university sent me to be your new assistant."

"I don't care if the university sent you. I decide if you stay or not. Now take that pile of books there and box them up. I'm done with them."

Jason begins packing up the books. He's recieved some instruction on how best to care for The Inventor. "As much as possible, let him think he's in control. As long as he thinks he's making the decisions, he will be open to your suggestions. He is far too focused on his own inventions to resist you." So even though packing boxes is not part of Jason's job description, Jason packs the boxes thinking this is a good way to keep the professor agreeable.

After the books are boxed, Jason stands up, "Okay, that's done. Professor Ralston, have you taken your meds today?"

The Inventor pulls out a ray gun and shoots Jason. "You're hired." Before Jason can react, he shrinks out of his clothes, The Inventor fishes him out and lifts his naked body up to the professor's face. Jason screams but The Inventor patiently waits for Jason to calm down.

"What did you do to me?"

"Isn't it obvious? I shrank you."

"Why?"

"Because you packed up those books like I asked you to. All the others the university sent over refused saying it wasn't part of their job description. I've had to tolerate those selfish assistants cause I needed them but I think I'm going to enjoy having you for an assistant."

"You shrank me because I packed books? Am I the only person you shrank?"

"Yes."

"Because I packed books?"

"You act like its the end of the world. Did you really think I would shrink you without returning you to normal?"

"I didn't think you would shrink me, period."

"Yes, well I can see how you might have been surprised by that. Now let me tell you how I expect you to do your job. I will remind you as often as needed until you get it right. You will call me Mister Inventor. You will not call me professor. I may let you call me Paul or Mister Ralston on occasion but most of the time, you will call me Mister Inventor, is that clear?"

"Yes, Mister Inventor."

"Good, I'm about to return you to normal height but before I do that, you need to know that I can control your size at any time. What I shot you with embedded a tag in you so that anytime I send a super low frequency radio signal out, that tag will respond by changing your size. So don't even think about running away or telling anyone. You wouldn't want to find yourself shrunk somewhere out there in this great big world. Super low frequency radio signals can travel much further than normal radio signals. And don't think about attacking me either. I have programmed for you to shrink at the same time each day so you want me around to return you to normal. Do you understand?"

Jason nods. The Inventor sets him on the floor and flips a switch. Jason grows back to normal size but sits there quietly putting his clothes on.

"I wouldn't be so quick to get dressed if I were you. I want to shrink you again."

Jason stops, "You're asking me to volunteer to be shrunk?"

"No, I'm going to shrink you and use you as a guinea pig whenever I want. I just want you to know that I'm not completely heartless. I have a heart that I misplaced somewhere in all this clutter. Now, if you try to leave, I will shrink you. If you tell me you are ready to be shrunk, than I will shrink you and go take my medicines like you want me too. I'll be a good patient. But if you aren't ready to be shrunk than just hang out here in the library with me. You could read or put your headphones on and take some time to think about it. I won't shrink you. I'll go back to grading these papers as long as you stay here."
1311.title: Lab Assistant

13111.content:
Jason finishes dressing. Then he gets up and heads for the door. He shrinks out of his clothes a second time. The Inventor fishes him out of his clothes, puts him next to the desk and returns him to normal size. Then The Inventor grades papers. Jason slowly reaches for his clothes again, dresses again and heads for the door. He shrinks out of his clothes a third time. The Inventor patiently retrieves him, puts him next to the desk and returns him to normal a third time.

Jason decides to skip the clothing because he is tired of redressing. He races outside as fast as he can. The Inventor's front yard is enclosed by a hedge that blocks the view. Jason manages to close the door behind him and almost makes it past the hedge. He runs so fast that when he shrinks, his momentum fling his tiny body into the hedge. He is sore but he doesn't detect any injuries.

The Inventor takes his time retrieving Jason. Jason has enough time to recognize that there is no way the professor could have shot him with the ray gun this last time. It must be the tag the professor spoke about, the tag caused the shrinking. But whatever the tag is, it must be microscopic because even at Jason's mere inches in height, he can't detect any tag.

The Inventor finally opens the door. Using a walker, he slowly makes his way across the yard. He groans as he bends down to look at Jason who realizes that, no matter how much he's faster than the professor, escape is hopeless. The Inventor crouches down on the ground and just looks at Jason for a while. The Inventor has all the time in the world. Jason, on the other hand, is not going anywhere and will never go anywhere again without a need to be rescued by the professor..

Jason realizes that it's kind of nice being out in the garden with the professor. He's so patient and the weather is so peaceful. Jason leans back and relaxes. The professor relaxes too.

After maybe about ten minutes, The Inventor slowly stands up, plucks Jason from the hedge, takes him back to the desk and returns him to normal. The Inventor grades papers ignoring Jason.

Jason dresses but doesn't try to escape. He thinks about hurting the professor but decides against it since he needs the professor so much. Jason sits on a couch in the library and observes the professor. The Inventor grades papers and ignores Jason.

"It's not part of my job description to be your guinea pig."

"It is now."

"I only came here to remind you to take your medicine and to make sure you are taking care of yourself."

"Then you better get to it. As soon as you are ready, I'll shrink you down and carry you to my medicine cabinet. Until you are ready, I'll continue to forget my meds."

There is a long pause in the conversation.

"Don't you have any empathy? Can't you see this from my perspective? You kidnapped me."

"I guess I did didn't I. I'm sorry. I am being unfair. I'll make you a deal. After today, you can submit a schedule to me of when you want days off. Almost any time you want time off, you can have it. I'll sometimes even let you decide how small you want to be."

Jason knows that he can't escape but the patience of The Inventer is amazing. They wait for hours while The Inventor ignores Jason. A few people visit briefly but Jason knows not to risk being shrunk and The Inventer is absolutely calm at all times.

"What if you fall asleep and I escape?"

"By tomorrow, you will shrink."

"But I can ask for days off?"

"Yes. You can even have weeks off if you want to travel but you have to tell me first how long you will be gone. The day you are supposed to be back here you will shrink."

"You're not going to use me for sex, are you?"

"My interests are purely scientific."

"So you're going to dissect me instead."

"As tempting as that sounds, I'd be out one guinea pig that way. No, I give you my word of honor that I will not harm you and I will try to avoid causing pain."

Jason waited a few more hours for good measure but it was clear The Inventor would not give up. "Fine. I'm your guinea pig."

"Take off you clothes, fold them neatly and bring them to me."

Jason did so and then covered himself. The Inventor put Jason's clothes in a drawer of his desk.

"Don't cover yourself. I need to see what I'm working with." The Inventor then measured every part of Jason's body.

“Dude where have you been!?” Ben blurted out before greetings could be exchanged. “You were supposed to meet us here at the bar 15 minutes ago!”

“I completely forgot Sorry. Crazy day at work.” Jason sighed. “I’m actually not too far. I’ll see you in five.” Jason regretted saying that as soon as the words left his lips. He was tired and socializing with friends was the last thing he wanted to do in this condition.
“Well hurry up!” Ben said curtly. “Rache and Sarah are waiting.”

Before Jason could respond, Ben hung up the phone. Jason released a loud sigh, tightened the belt on his pants a notch the turned on his heal towards the direction of the bar.

As he made his way to the large, green door marking the entrance to the bar a strange tingling sensation hit him from head to toes. No sooner had it began did it end. "So how does this work?" Jason asks.

It is a big lab with lots of people and machinery. It is a real lab and not one of those mad scientist labs you read about in fiction. Most of the machines are computers calculating out different formulas. There is a small table with a bowl of fruit on it. Next to it is a booth seven feet tall and three feet by three feet. The interior of the booth is covered by sensors and special lasers called digitizers. A few feet away is an identical booth. Between the booths is a computer station where Paul, Ben and Jason are talking.

Paul says, "You put something like an apple in one of these booths. It doesn't matter which booth. The booth digitizes it. Then the computer sends the apple to whichever booth you tell it too and recreates the apple."

Ben says, "There are so many ways that could go wrong. Has it been tested thoroughly?"

Paul says, "Thoroughly, we've followed standard scientific procedures and then we sat around brainstorming to think of anything outside of standard procedures we should test for."

Ben asks, "So how do you know it's the same apple?"

Paul says, "We trained some monkeys to do random tricks that no other monkey was ever trained to do. We sent them through the digitizer and they came out still knowing their uniquely taught trick but not knowing tricks they hadn't been taught. Even the monkeys memories made it through the digitizer. Their personality, their habits, every detail made it through the digitizer intact without alteration."

Jason asks, "So we can create identical copies of those monkeys?"

Paul says, "Unfortunately, no. We've tried but the copies came out dead. We've tested that over and over again. Some things we can make copies of such as apples, flies, and snails. We've already got a team looking into using this technology to mass produce food and that's going well. There does seem to be limits on how many copies can be made and the more complicated the item, the fewer copies can be made successfully, but we haven't figured out the nature of the limit. So far, every mammal makes it through the digitizer but cannot be copied."

Jason says, "So we can only go through the digitizer once. That would not make a good system for teleportation."

Paul says, "You can go through as often as you like. We sent one monkey through twenty times each day and so far, there's been no limit. The monkey comes out exactly as it went in with no ill health effects. We just can't make living copies and we are baffled as to why. Only the first copy sent to the digitizer lives. All other copies are perfect copies with no reason for death but they're dead anyway."

They set up a demonstration. They put the bowl of fruit in the digitizer and digitize it.

Paul says, "Now here's the fun part. While the fruit is digitized, we can play with it. We can make the apple bigger than all the other fruit."

Jason asks, "Will it come out the same apple?"

Paul explains, "There are limits. We can play with it all we want digitally but most changes will automatically revert to normal before coming back out into the real world. We can make the digitized apple humongous but when it comes back to the real world, it will still be within the size limits of real world apples. That seems to be the primary limit on what kind of alterations we can do. We took a monkey and switched it's arms and legs but it came out normal with arms and legs where they are supposed to be. So other than minor modifications, this cannot be used as a transformation device in the real world. However, while digitized, there are no limits. We can even pixelate."

Paul types and the apple turns into a two dimensional apple made of twenty pixels.

I didn't know there was anyone near where I crashed or I would have been more careful with the warp field. "Unfortunately, it's not that easy. I will return you eventually but I can't stop mid stream and turn around. If I even try, she'll dump us at whatever place and time we happen to be at that moment. It would be like hitting another zbeing but worse."

Jason asks, "Aren't you afraid of altering history?"

"Not really. There are forces that protect history. The zbeings for example. Certain critical moments in history are surrounded by zbeings that prevent us from getting near those times and places. We've mapped the coordinates of several zbeings. For example, there are forty zbeings surrounding Adolph Hitler. We've tried several times to assassinate Hitler but the zbeings keep deflecting us."

Ben asks, "So Jason and I aren't protected by zbeings. Does that mean we are historically insignificant?"

"Let me find out." The man consults his computer. "No, one of your descendants annhilates all people who speak English. We've mapped some zbeings guarding him. He does so with much less showmanship this time, just touching each volunteer and instantly they are back to normal. They get dressed and leave.

Ben and Jason don't talk to each on their way home. They don't live together but they do live in the same apartment building. Then they receive messages from the Great Ralstino. Ben receives a message telling him that whenever he wants, he can turn Jason's legs around. Jason receives a message telling him that whenever he wants, he can turn Ben upside down. Both messages include that the Great Ralstino thinks they are lovers and would appreciate this addition to their love life.

Ben comes over immediately and both guys explain endlessly that neither one is gay.

Then after the talking fades into an awkward silence, Ben asks, "So do you want to test and see if I can spin your legs around?"

Jason doesn't want to but the message said whenever Ben wanted to. So Jason strips and Ben turns his legs backwards. Ben just stands there amazed at what he sees. He does feel it to make sure it's real.

(Remember the rules and don't take this to one of the forbidden fetishes.)
151222.title: Ben and Jason leave the stage

choices: They go to one of Ralstino's shows
15131.content:
They see a poster for a stage hypnotist advertising a more risque show.

Jason says, "What a joke. Hypnotists always say that they can't make people do what they absolutely refuse to do. So basically hypnotists look for people of loose morals to hypnotize as in, they aren't actually hypnotizing anyone. They're just giving exhibitionists an excuse to expose themselves. Those people would gladly expose themselves anyway. All they need is a socially aproved opportunity."

Rick says, "Just like you? Whenever we go to the lake, you go skinny dipping whether girls are present or not."

Jason says, "Unless the law is there to prevent me. Alright, I confess I'm a little bit of an exhibitionist but I'm not a pervert about it. I just like to be naked."

Ben says, "I was raised to believe that hypnotism is the same as demon possession."

Mark asks, "Do you believe that?"

"I don't know."

Mark says, "Tell you what. Let's see if we can talk to this hypnotist and ask him some questions."

Ben asks, "Are you sure that's such a good idea."

Jason says, "I doubt they'll let us backstage."

Mark says, "It never hurts to ask. Come on."

They follow Mark but Ben hangs back. There's surprisingly few people around. There isn't even a security guard. Mark knocks on the door.

Someone in the crowd says, "Won't do you no good. The show was canceled. The Amazing Ralstino had an accident. He's in the hospital."

"Is he alright? "

"Just a few broken bones and bruising but he hasn't been released from the hospital."

Mark asks, "We'd like to visit with him. Do you know which hospital?"

"I think it was Mercy but I don't know if they'll allow visitors."

Mark says, "It never hurts to ask. Come on."

They make their way to the hospital and find it very easy to visit the Amazing Ralstino. He has his entire left leg plus his right ankle in a cast. His left arm is wrapped but not in a cast. His right arm is riddled with IVs and monitors. He wears a neck brace. He even has a canula in his nose but he's awake and peaceful.

"Mister Ralstino?"

"Come in, come in. My family is far away and my tour staff is busy making financial arrangements. I'd be happy to have some visitors but don't call me Ralstino. My real name is Ralston but you can call me Paul."

"Are you okay?"

"Well I've been better. The doctors are waiting for some tests to come back but if the tests turn out clear, I might be released tomorrow but they advised me to stay off my feet for a few weeks."

"What happened?"

"Car accident. I think it was a drunk driver but I was too busy being put in an ambulance to know for sure. All I know is a redneck truck slammed into the driver's side where I was sitting. I was pinned in the wreckage and I'm sure the car is totalled. But you didn't come here to hear me complain. You have questions about hypnosis."

Ben asks, "How did you know?"

"I'm psychic."

Ben gives Paul a strange look.

"Naw, I'm kidding. I'm just very familiar with human nature. I have to be in this business."

Jason asks, "So you can identify the exhibitionists who are eager to expose themselves to an audience."

"Just like you?" Everyone laughs. "You are partly right. Hypnosis is real but not as powerful as most people think it is. If you have a strong will, you can resist hypnosis. So I do have to look for volunteers that are less resistant. Plus my own sense of ethics holds me back like a power dampener preventing me from pushing the volunteers too hard."

Mark asks, "So you wouldn't be able to hypnotize Ben here?"

Paul looks Ben up and down. "Don't be so sure about that. I sense he might be more open than he seems."

"What? Oh no. You're not going to hypnotize me. I refuse."

"Alright. I won't hypnotize you but I probably could."

Mark asks, "How about hypnotizing Jason here?"

"He's too easy. No challenge. But, I do sense some limits, some things it would be hard to get him to do."

"That's right. I'd be afraid to volunteer for your show because of how risque it gets sometimes. I'd want to know where the boundaries are before I volunteer."

Ben asks, "Isn't hypnosis the same as demon possession?"

Paul answers, "Not at all. I have seen cases of demon possession so that is real as well. But demon possession is connected to sin. Only people who are drenched in sin become demon possessed and even then, it's not by means of hypnosis."

They continue to have a nice visit with the Amazing Ralstino.
15131.title: Bet you can't hypnotize me

info.brief_description: So I can write what I want to write
info.description:
This interactive is primarily so that I can write the stories I want to write without having to adapt to someone elses fetishes. In particular, I find that too many interactives treat women like they are nothing but bodies for a man's pleasure. OR too many interactives spend way too much time talking about gross things such as farting.

I don't want to limit myself or impose rules on myself but I can confidenty say that a common theme in my writing is ENM (Embarrassed Naked Males). I like it when men realize why it's so wrong to treat women so disrespectfully. Now I'm not into abuse so I don't go to the extremes of femdom or any other kind of dom, but I do like to see it when proud, arrogant men have a humbling experience.

Ben and Jason are two characters I have written about for years. They are my go-to characters for stories of this type. Their specific details may change from story to story but certain aspects remain the same. Jason is always the more laid back, the more willing to try new things, and the more experienced of the two. Ben is always the more rules conscious, the least willing to try new things and the most naive of the two. There are a few other characters that may appear in these stories. Most frequently are Rachel (my ideal woman), Sarah (beautiful body but ugly soul), and Paul (the doctor/professor/expert).

If a chapter is marked reserved, it means that I intend to write that chapter. Otherwise, the chapter is open to first come, first serve. I do reserve the right to edit or delete at my discretion so try to write in a similar theme as I do. If you are uncertain whether I will allow your idea, email or IM me about it first. I will give GP for chapters I like.

As far as other rules, I'm still figuring out which rules I want and which I don't care for. Here's the rules so far:

1. Preserve consistency. I don't want to see chapters that invalidate previous chapters. (Example: After a chapter in which Ben shrinks, I don't want to see a chapter in which he's back to normal with the introduction of a female character who grows followed by a chapter in which the female disappears and Ben turns into a dog.) Any chapters with abrupt or illogical changes will be deleted.

2. There are many fetishes that appear along with ENM. I enjoy some of these related fetishes more than I enjoy others. The following lists these related fetishes on a scale from 0 to -10. 0 means that you should feel free to include them as long as they don't cause any story inconsistencies. -10 means please don't include them unless avoiding them would cause story inconsistencies. I may delete chapters if they have too much of the the fetishes I don't care for.

0 shrink, detach, flat, hypno, tickle, inanimate (but only if it is partial or temporary), boy next door, athlete, military, twink, business suit, college, female-to-male

-5 male-to-female, anthro/furry, growth, bulging muscles, medical, domination, bondage, slave,

-10 destruction, death, vore (I'll make an exception for non-destructive cock or mouth vore), mind erasing, torture, pain, spanking, diapers, anything to do with the anus, scat, farts, slob, weight gain, fanfiction, underage,

3. If adding a choice chapter, make sure the choices are significant. One thing I hate in interactives is trivial choices such as "right or left", "blue or red", or "one minute or two minutes". If there is no significant difference between the options, I will replace them. (I will add options anyway, if you cannot provide any. I will also rename options after chapters are written so the options will fit their chapters better.)

4. Use good grammar. I don't mind minor errors but when the writing is so bad that it is confusing, I may have to delete it. Please don't have more than one character speaking in the same paragraph. Each paragraph should focus on one character's actions. Avoid run on sentences. Most sentences should have a subject-verb structure.

5. third person, present tense, limited omniscience. Except for dialogue, avoid using past tense verbs, "I" and "you". Also avoid writing about what a character thinks or feels. A little is okay but don't overdo it.

6. Regarding sexual orientation: The characters may have different orientations depending on which branch you start with. Try to avoid declaring an orientation but once an orientation is declared, stick with it. That is, you should only declare a character's orientation when it matters.

Avoid stereotypical thinking. Just because someone acts like a hetero, doesn't mean he is one so leave such matters ambiguous until it actually makes a difference to the story. Likewise, allow characters to act gay without declaring that they are gay until it actually makes a difference to the story.

I firmly believe that sexual orientation is far more dynamic than most people recognize. Not only does it fall on a continuum with no one being 100% hetero or 100% homo, but it's a multi dimensional continuum where people can be attracted to one, fall in love with another and lust after a third.

7. A few branches have additional rules that only apply to the chapters of that branch. These rules are few but they will be enforced for those branches. You may set your own rules for branches you start but don't go overboard or make rules against the overall theme of this interactive. (Example: Don't make a rule limiting gender options to female only.)

"Guide to Ben and Jason interactive" is a guide to inspire you to add chapters.
